It does NOT work with 64bit, it DOES WORK with 32 bit, if you want it to work on 64bit , you have to install xp or lower inside windows 7. (dont know how) Tried both my original disc as this download. This one works with 32bit (it has nothing to do with wath version of windows)

Original installer is 16-bit aka won't work with a x64 OS. You can either install Windows Virtual Machine with Windows XP Mode or find an updated installer (http://forum.dune2k.com/). 

If you plan on using this torrent, you will need some sort of emulation to install the game. Once you install the game on your virtual PC, copy the files onto your actual computer. Make sure you also copy the MOVIES and MISSIONS folders from the disc. You will need to update RESOURCE.CFG with notepad. 

The only NO CD patch I could find was also based on a 16-bit installer, so crack the .exe before copying to your x64 system.

Please somebody tell me how to make a good resolution :(

To those wonder why the screen shifts when you start the game, the screen shifts because the resolution DLL is an old one. Old games tend to have issues with screen alignment and coloring.

Right click on your desktop and click "Graphics Properties", continue to the "Display Settings" tab and click, "Aspect Ratio Settings".

When the little window pops up, click either "Maintain Aspect Ratio" or, "Center Desktop".

If you maintain the ratio, lower your screen size to help the game keep up with the pixel decompression and filtering.

If you choose to center is, the same is true as ratio but, this time it gets little tricky because you might still have a black box around your game.

I've had this picture shift happen to me with the Warcraft 1 game but, I managed to fix it by going into the text files and resizing the resolution to fix my screen. its not easy.
